alert.note: Alert for Moses Lake Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:33PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Adams and southeastern Grant Counties through 600 PM PDT... At 533 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Warden, or 10 miles south of Moses Lake, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moses Lake and Cascade Valley. This includes Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 175 and 179. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
